means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 贾斯特来源于拉丁语教名，含义是“正义，法律”(right,law)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"公正的，公平的，不偏不倚的"之意。
means: impartial ： 侧重对任何人或任何一方没有成见或偏袒。
just ： 多用于庄重场合，指不受个人利益得失或感情倾向的影响，侧重按照公认的准则或标准处理问题。
fair ： 普通常用词，指不偏不倚地对待人和物，侧重不受个人感情、偏见或利益所影响。
neutral ： 强调持中立态度，不偏袒任何一方，甚至不作最后的裁决。
objective ： 着重客观、真实，不为个人偏见、兴趣、感情或看法所左右。

phrase.cizu_name: just a minute (或 moment，或 second，等)

jx.jx_en_mean: used to ask someone to wait or pause for a short time
jx.jx_cn_mean: 请稍等［用于请某人等候或暂停片刻］

jx.jx_en_mean: (with reference to time and numbers) exactly
arranged or done very neatly and carefully

lj.lj_ly: polishing the furniture and making everything just so.
lj.lj_ls: 油漆家具并把一切都收拾的井井有条。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (正式)好，没问题［用于表示同意］

lj.lj_ly: This job is just about done.
lj.lj_ls: 这件工作差不多做完了

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin justus, from jus 'law, right'

encyclopedia.content: just，英语单词，作副词有只是，仅仅；刚刚；正好，恰好；实在；刚要等意；作形容词有公正的，合理的；正直的，正义的；正确的；公平的；应得的等意。

entry.tran: 刚才；方才；刚刚
entry.def: You use just to say that something happened a very short time ago, or is starting to happen at the present time. For example, if you say that someone has just arrived, you mean that they arrived a very short time ago.

example.ex: I've just bought a new house...
example.tran: 我刚买了栋新房子。

example.ex: The two had only just met...
example.tran: 这两个人只不过才刚刚认识。

entry.tran: 正在；正要；正准备
entry.def: If you say that you are just doing something, you mean that you are doing it now and will finish it very soon. If you say that you are just about to do something, or just going to do it, you mean that you will do it very soon.

example.ex: I'm just making the sauce for the cauliflower...
example.tran: 我正在弄花椰菜的调味汁呢。

example.ex: I'm  just going to walk down the lane now and post some letters...
example.tran: 我正打算沿这条小巷往南走，去寄几封信。

entry.tran: （用于强调）正，就，恰恰（在某个时刻）
entry.def: You can use just to emphasize that something is happening at exactly the moment of speaking or at exactly the moment that you are talking about.

example.ex: Randall would just now be getting the Sunday paper...
example.tran: 兰德尔这个时候应该正在拿周日的报纸。

example.ex: Just then the phone rang...
example.tran: 正在那时，电话响了。

entry.tran: （尤用于纠正错误的观点）只是，仅仅是
entry.def: You use just to indicate that something is no more important, interesting, or difficult, for example, than you say it is, especially when you want to correct a wrong idea that someone may get or has already got.

example.ex: It's just a suggestion...
example.tran: 这只是个建议。

example.ex: It's not just a financial matter...
example.tran: 这不仅仅是资金的问题。

entry.tran: （用于强调所谈的只是一小部分而非全部）仅仅是，只不过是
entry.def: You use just to emphasize that you are talking about a small part, not the whole of an amount.

example.ex: That's just one example of the kind of experiments you can do...
example.tran: 这只不过是你可以做的各种试验中的一例罢了。

example.ex: These are just a few of the many options available.
example.tran: 这些只不过是众多可能的选择中的几个。

entry.tran: （用于强调数量少或时间短）只是，仅仅
entry.def: You use just to emphasize how small an amount is or how short a length of time is.

example.ex: Stephanie and David redecorated a room in just three days...
example.tran: 斯蒂法妮和戴维仅仅花了3天就把一个房间装饰一新。

example.ex: Remember he's just fourteen years old.
example.tran: 记住，他才14岁。

entry.tran: （用于动词前表示事情的结果糟糕，很可能导致局面恶化）只（会），只不过
entry.def: You can use just in front of a verb to indicate that the result of something is unfortunate or undesirable and is likely to make the situation worse rather than better.

example.ex: Leaving like I did just made it worse...
example.tran: 像我那样一走了之只会让事情变得更糟。

example.ex: They just hurt the people in their community, they didn't really solve any problem.
example.tran: 他们只是伤害了他们社区的居民，并没有真正解决任何问题。

entry.tran: （用于表示情况在很小的程度上属实）刚刚，勉强，差一点就不
entry.def: You use just to indicate that what you are saying is the case, but only by a very small degree or amount.

example.ex: Her hand was just visible by the light from the sitting room...
example.tran: 借着起居室的灯光，勉强能看见她的手。

example.ex: It was Colin's voice, only just audible...
example.tran: 那是科林的声音，勉强能听得见。

entry.tran: （与might，may和could连用，表示稍有可能）可能，也许
entry.def: You use just with 'might,' 'may,' and 'could', when you mean that there is a small chance of something happening, even though it is not very likely.

example.ex: It's an old trick but it just might work...
example.tran: 这是个老掉牙的把戏了，不过也许会有用。

example.ex: It may just be possible.
example.tran: 那也许有可能。

entry.tran: （用于加强语气，表示生气、赞美、肯定等）硬是，就是，简直
entry.def: You use just to emphasize the following word or phrase, in order to express feelings such as annoyance, admiration, or certainty.

example.ex: She just won't relax...
example.tran: 她就是放松不下来。

example.ex: I knew you'd be here. I just knew...
example.tran: 我知道你会在这儿的。我就是知道。

entry.tran: （用于指示、礼貌的请求或表示意图的陈述，用来弱化语气）请，只要，只管…就好了
entry.def: You use just with instructions, polite requests, or statements of intention, to make your request or statement seem less difficult.

example.ex: Could you just give us a description of your cat?...
example.tran: 能否请您向我们描述一下您的猫？

example.ex: Can you just lift the table for a second?...
example.tran: 你把桌子抬起来一下好吗？

entry.tran: 请稍候；稍等一下
entry.def: You use just in expressions such as just a minute and just a moment to ask someone to wait for a short time.

example.ex: 'Let me in, Di.' — 'Okay. Just a minute.'
example.tran: “让我进来，迪。”——“好的。稍等一下。”

entry.tran: （用于打断某人，以表示不同意、解释某事或让其保持冷静）稍等一下，且慢
entry.def: You can use just in expressions such as just a minute and just a moment to interrupt someone, for example in order to disagree with them, explain something, or calm them down.

example.ex: Well, now just a second, I don't altogether agree with the premise.
example.tran: 嗯，且慢，我并不完全同意这个前提。

entry.tran: （用于否定附加问句，表示完全赞同）难道不是吗，确实如此
entry.def: You can use just with negative question tags, for example 'isn't he just?' and 'don't they just!', to say that you agree completely with what has been said.

example.ex: 'That's crazy,' I said. 'Isn't it just?' he said...
example.tran: “那简直是疯了，”我说。“谁说不是呢？”他说。

example.ex: 'The manager's going to have some tough decisions to make.' — 'Won't he just.'
example.tran: “经理将要作一些非常艰难的决定。”——“确实如此。”

entry.tran: （表示完全可以想象）完全，简直
entry.def: If you say that you can just see or hear something, you mean that it is easy for you to imagine seeing or hearing it.

example.ex: I can just see the nasty suspicious looks I'd be getting from you if we started whispering together...
example.tran: 要是我们开始凑在一起交头接耳，我简直能想象到你那种令人讨厌的怀疑的目光了。

example.ex: I can just hear her telling her friends, 'Well, I blame his mother!'
example.tran: 我简直能听到她和她的朋友们说，“哎呀，都是他妈妈的错！”

entry.tran: 确切地；精确地
entry.def: You use just to mean exactly, when you are specifying something precisely or asking for precise information.

example.ex: It is really not clear just why he became a Socialist...
example.tran: 他为何成为社会党人的确切原因实际上还不清楚。

example.ex: There are no statistics about just how many people won't vote...
example.tran: 没有统计数字表明具体将有多少人不参加投票。

entry.tran: 恰恰是；正是
entry.def: You use just to emphasize that a particular thing is exactly what is needed or fits a particular description exactly.

example.ex: Kiwi fruit are just the thing for a healthy snack...
example.tran: 猕猴桃作为有益健康的零食是再好不过了。

example.ex: 'Let's get a coffee somewhere.'—'I know just the place.'
example.tran: “我们找个地方喝杯咖啡吧。”——“我知道个好地方。”

entry.tran: 正（如）；正（像）
entry.def: You use just in expressions such as just like ,just as...as, and just the same when you are emphasizing the similarity between two things or two people.

example.ex: Behind the facade they are just like the rest of us...
example.tran: 在那副外表背后，他们和我们大家是完全一样的。

example.ex: He worked just as hard as anyone...
example.tran: 他和所有人一样非常努力。

entry.tran: 差不多；几乎；近乎
entry.def: You use just about to indicate that what you are talking about is so close to being the case that it can be regarded as being the case.

example.ex: There are those who believe that Nick Price is just about the best golfer in the world...
example.tran: 有一些人认为尼克·普赖斯几乎就是世界上最优秀的高尔夫球运动员了。

example.ex: What does she read? Just about everything...
example.tran: 她看些什么书？几乎什么都看。

entry.tran: 勉强；差一点就不
entry.def: You use just about to indicate that what you are talking about is in fact the case, but only by a very small degree or amount.

example.ex: I can just about tolerate it at the moment...
example.tran: 当时我差一点就忍受不了了。

example.ex: We've got just about enough time to get there.
example.tran: 我们刚刚有足够的时间赶到那里。

entry.tran: （用于表示接近于某一具体数量）几乎，差不多
entry.def: Just on is used in mentioning an almost exact number or amount.

example.ex: Eve, squinting at the clock, saw it was just on 7 a.m...
example.tran: 伊夫眯着眼瞥了一下钟，看到差不多是早上7点钟。

example.ex: Many were retired people, and just on a fifth were in their fifties.
example.tran: 许多都是退休的人，其中差不多有五分之一年龄在五十多岁。

entry.tran: 对极了；正是
entry.def: Just so is used to agree with or confirm a statement that has been made.

example.ex: 'She has a large flat in Mayfair.' — 'Just so.'
example.tran: “她在梅费尔有个大公寓。”——“正是。”

entry.tran: 严格按照要求的
entry.def: If things are just so, they are done or arranged exactly as they should be or exactly as someone wants them.

example.ex: I do her hair, and it has to be just so.
example.tran: 我必须得按她的要求为她做头发。

entry.tran: （用于弱化抱怨、给出建议或理由时的语气）只不过，只是
entry.def: You use the expression it's just that when you are making a complaint, suggestion, or excuse, so that the person you are talking to will not get annoyed with you.

example.ex: I'm sorry I struck you. I didn't mean to. It's just that I was so mad...
example.tran: 很抱歉我打了你。我不是有意的，只不过我当时气极了。

example.ex: Your hair is all right; it's just that you need a haircut.
example.tran: 你的头发挺好的；只是你需要剪剪了。

entry.tran: 公正的；正当的；正义的；合理的
entry.def: If you describe a situation, action, or idea as just, you mean that it is right or acceptable according to particular moral principles, such as respect for all human beings.

example.ex: In a just society there must be a system whereby people can seek redress through the courts...
example.tran: 在一个公正的社会中，一定会有一套人们可以通过法庭寻求赔偿的体制。

example.ex: She fought honestly for a just cause and for freedom...
example.tran: 她为了正义的事业和自由而光明正大地斗争。

means.word_mean: 1. used especially of what is legally or ethically right or proper or fitting;
2. implying justice dictated by reason, conscience, and a natural sense of what is fair to all;

sentences.sentence: "an equitable distribution of gifts among the children"

means.word_mean: 3. free from favoritism or self-interest or bias or deception; or conforming with established standards or rules;

sentences.sentence: "the life of the nation is secure only while the nation is honest, truthful, and virtuous"- Frederick Douglass
"it is simply a matter of time"
"he was doing precisely (or exactly) what she had told him to do"
"it was just as he said--the jewel was gone"
"had scarcely rung the bell when the door flew open"
"would have scarce arrived before she would have found some excuse to leave"- W.B.Yeats

list.explanation: 毫无突出特点的人或物，平庸之辈

example.en: He had a time convincing them he was a genuine expert, not just another pretty face.
example.zh: 他曾一度使他们相信，他是一位真正的专家，而不是平庸之辈。

auth_sentence.content: It just seemed like the natural step for us.
auth_sentence.res_content: It just seemed like the natural step for us.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It just seemed like the natural step for us.

auth_sentence.content: Dissenters, well, they might just be converted.
auth_sentence.res_content: Dissenters, well, they might just be converted.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Dissenters, well, they might just be converted.

auth_sentence.content: But the vast majority will be just... alright.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the vast majority will be just... alright.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the vast majority will be just... alright.

stems_affixes.word_buile: just正确,正直→adj.正义的 adv.正好, 仅仅
just正确,正直→adj.正义的 adv.正好, 仅仅
just发誓,法律;正确,正直+ify……化→v.证明……是正当的

sentences.en: The coat is just the right size.
sentences.cn: 这件上衣的大小正好合适。

sentences.en: I just saw your sister standing over there.
sentences.cn: 我刚才看见你妹妹站在那边。

sentences.en: We have only just enough milk to last till Friday.
sentences.cn: 我们现有的牛奶勉强可以维持到星期五。

means.word_mean: 合理的, 有充分根据的

sentences.en: We hold that their proposal is just and reasonable.
sentences.cn: 我们认为他们的建议是合情合理的。

jushi.english: We have only just enough milk to last till Friday.
jushi.chinese: 我们现有的牛奶勉强可以维持到星期五。

jushi.english: We just need a tent supported on a rigid framework.
jushi.chinese: 我们正需要一座用坚硬的架子支撑的帐篷。

jushi.english: By the time I got to the airport, they were already calling my flight,I just barely made it.
jushi.chinese: 我到机场的时候,已经在叫我这个航班登机了,我好不容易才赶上。
